Package com.apriori.apt.testing

Tools for unit testing annotation processors using JUnit4.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AnnotationProcessorTestRunner
    A test runner for executing tests inside the context of the annotation processing phase of a Java compiler.
    CategorizingDiagnosticCollector
    A collector of diagnostic messages emitted by the compiler.
    TestEnvironment
    Information about the current test, processing, and round environments.
    TestJavaFileManager
    An in-memory file manager.
    TestJavaFileObject
    A simple in-memory file.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    CompilationFailedException
    An exception thrown if compilation fails.
  • Annotation Types Summary 
    Annotation Type Description
    ClassesToProcess
    An annotation on a test class or method that defines the classes to process.
    FilesToProcess
    An annotation on a test class or method that defines the files to process.
    InitializeProcessorField
    Indicates the name of a field on the test class that holds a Processor that should be initialized with the current ProcessingEnvironment prior to running each test case.
    InputFiles
    A set of input files that are loaded from resources.
    NoProcess
    Indicates a test method that should be run as a normal test, not in the context of annotation processing.
    OptionsForProcessing
    An annotation on a test class or method that defines the list of options to use.
    OutputFiles
    A set of "golden" output files that are loaded from resources.
    ProcessorUnderTest
    Indicates the type of processor to test.
    Reentrant
    Annotates a test method as being re-entrant.
    ValidateGeneratedFiles
    An annotation on a test class or method that defines the output files to validate.

Package com.apriori.apt.testing Description

Tools for unit testing annotation processors using JUnit4. This package contains a test runner and numerous annotations for defining test cases that make it trivial to build automated tests of your annotation processors.
See Also:
AnnotationProcessorTestRunner
